name: The 2011 Area Classification for Output Areas
body:
Through collaboration between the Office for National Statistics (ONS) and University College London (UCL), the 2011 OAC has been created using 2011 UK Census data. The 2011 OAC is a three-tiered hierarchical geodemographic classification of the UK built at the Output Area / Small Area level. It consists of 8 Supergroups, 26 Groups and 76 Subgroups. 

A number of 2011 OAC resources are available on the [ONS webpage](http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/geography/products/area-classifications/ns-area-classifications/ns-2011-area-classifications/index.html) and [Open Geodemographics](http://http://www.opengeodemographics.com/)

This webpage is designed to provide additional material and information to aid use of the 2011 OAC. The following resources are available:

### Cluster Lookup

2011 OAC CSV Lookup: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC DBF Lookup: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC breakdown by Local Authority (or equivalent): Download ZIP File

### Shapefiles

2011 OAC: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC Cartogram: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC Buildings: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC in London: Download ZIP File 

2011 OAC in London Buildings: Download ZIP File 

### Code

Code used to create the 2011 OAC: Open link

### Maps 

Interactive map: Open link 

Map of Supergroups: Download PDF 

Map of Groups: Download PDF 

Map of Subgroups: Download ZIP File 

Map of Supergroups in London: Download PDF 

Mapping the Supergroup Similarities*: Download ZIP File 

Map of Supergroup assignments to buildings in the UK++: Download PDF 

Map of Supergroup assignments to buildings in London+++: Download PDF 

++ Please note instead of each Output Area or Small Area being assigned to one distinct Supergroup, they are given values representing how similar they are to all eight Supergroups. The lower the number, the higher the similarity that Output Area or Small Area has to the characteristics described in the Pen Portraits. 

+++ Please note these maps should not be interpreted as having a higher level of precision than a standard choropleth map of Output Areas and Small Areas. The colour of an individual building is derived from the average of the Output Area or Small Area it is located in, and is not a reflection of that particular property itself. 

### Descriptions and Cluster Profiles

2011 OAC Hierarchical Structure: Download PDF

2011 OAC Pen Portraits: Open link

2011 OAC Cluster Radial Plots: Download PDF

2011 OAC Cluster Bar Plots: Download PDF

2011 OAC Cluster Profile Data: Download ZIP File

### Input Data

2011 OAC 167 Initial Variables Dataset: Download ZIP File

2011 OAC 60 Final Variables Dataset: Download ZIP File

2011 OAC 60 Final Variable Names: Download PDF 

2011 UK Output Areas and Small Areas Codes and Total Population: Download CSV File

### Cluster Evaluation 

Variable Correlation: Download PDF 

Lorenz Curves, Gini Coefficients and Distribution Plots: Download ZIP File

### Colour Scheme

2011 OAC Colour Scheme: Download ZIP File

2011 OAC ArcGIS Style: Download ZIP File

### Logo

2011 OAC Logo: Download ZIP File
